forum.content:
筆記進度在 9/14
應該是看不到到頭日了，借放一些當下看到，但又覺得重要的句子，方便以後轉移到臉書

1There's no point raking over the past and opening old sores.
對往事糾纏不清，揭開舊瘡疤沒有任何意義。
* rake over (over:翻面)

2England's World Cup hero is determined to play through the pain barrier.
英格蘭的世界杯英雄決定帶傷上陣。
* the pain barrier

3It seems to ease all the aches and pains of a hectic and tiring day.
繁忙勞碌了一天所帶來的周身酸痛似乎被一掃而空。
* hectic and tiring 繁忙勞碌

4The emotional baggage I'm hauling around.
拖累我的感情包袱。
* haul around (拖著走)
* encumbrance (cum, cub: lean, lie)
* impediment (ped: foot), burden, load

5In the past Iran has found clever ways to circumvent an array of less formidable sanctions.
过去伊朗巧妙地规避了各种棘手的制裁。
* circumvent (cir: round, vent:come)
* formidable (formid: fear, like insurmountable, but more of sth in awe)

6The ending of the novel is too pat and contrived.
小說的結局過於巧合，不自然。
* pat: well-timed
* contrive: trop>tri: turn, bend 硬兜一起

7Much romantic fiction is stylized, formulaic, and unrealistic.
許多言情小說是程式化、千篇一律且脫離現實的。
* be stylized 相互模仿的
* formulaic 刻板，俗套

8She began speaking, without preliminaries.
她開始說了，沒有任何客套話。

9We shall not pursue the matter any further.
我們將不再深究此事。
* pursue: engage in; carry out; proceed along

10He projected himself as the protector of national unity and harmony.
他把自己標榜成民族團結與和睦的捍衛者。
* unity and harmony; article > articulate
* project yourself 表現(塑造、營造、體現、標榜)、設想
* project your voice

11Lloyd George was most anxious to be agreeable and pleasant.
喬治極力想表現得平易近人、和藹親切。
* anxious; itch; dying [todo/for]
* at pains to do
* tickle one's interest
* titillating pictures 撩人
* jealous of 惟恐失去
* pleasant (人)彬彬有禮，親切，討喜

12She would have scorned to stoop to such tactics.
她就不會下作到使用那樣的伎倆。
* scorn: dismiss, refuse
* stoop to sth 下作，無恥
* would 是通常的傾向、意願，現在代替未來 would have 的 have 是把 時間軸挪到過去，假設以前的事情，若、如果、當初，就... (我忘光了，儘管去年寫過整套的學習心得)

13This talk betrays a certain cynicism about free trade.
這番講話流露出一種對自由貿易不看好的態度。
* cynic 噴子，酸民 > cynicism 憤世嫉俗，唱衰
* take a dim view of
* betray: wear, reveal

14He is bitter about the inaction of the other political parties.
對其他政黨的無作爲他多有挖苦。
* bitter about 不服氣，不甘願，忿忿不平
* a bitter pill; to the bitter end

15She floundered for a moment, then rallied again.
她掙扎了一陣，接著恢復過來。
* blind > blunder 跌跌撞撞
* found > flounder (fun-: bottom, base), as if trying not to sink 掙扎、維艱、張惶失措
* rally: recover (re+ally "拉"力賽的 pull; re: hold back, bring back, to reverse)
* founder: be awash, sink, fall through

16The old mine now stands completely deserted.
那座舊礦現在空無一人了。
* stand: to lie; to exist; to situate 處於、立場、樣貌、位居<~ accused of>
* deserted: be left alone, as if standing empty and bleak in which it stands

17Derelicts who could fit all their possessions in a paper bag.
可以把所有家當都放在紙袋中的流浪者。
* fit: to put in position

18He doesn't have to submit to normal disciplines.
他不用受制於一般的紀律。
discipline: 紀律、鍛鍊、訓練，當內容項目的時候，可變名詞
* submit: commit sth to the consideration or judgment of another
* commit: com: with, all around, whatever as it stands ; mit: put, send 身承、身負、承諾、沾染 的意思， 其形象是從 mit 的概念來的，字典自己都無力歸納了，只能覺得好笑
forum.title: 借用
